Issues.Title: fix(bazel): ng_package creates invalid typings reexport on windows
Issues.Body:
Currently when building a package on Windows, the typings re-export for secondary entry-points is not valid TypeScript. Similarly the metadata and the "package.json" files use non-posix paths and cause inconsistency within the NPM package.

For example:

_package.json_
```
  "esm5": "./esm5\\core.js",
  "esm2015": "./esm2015\\core.js",
```

_testing.d.ts_ (of the `core` package)
```
export * from './testing\testing';
```

**Note**: A test for the typings re-export is already part of the `golden` testing of the `ng_package`. Though, the golden testing seems to not run at the moment. We should try getting it work on Windows, and re-enable it on the CI in the future.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(bazel): ng_package creates invalid typings reexport on windows" (#27827)

Issues.Title: withCredentials deprecated, new docs don't cover setting credentials mode
Issues.Body:
### Description

I have a [problem](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/53925631/angular-cors-put-missing-authorization-header-after-options-preflight) with my Authorization header not being sent. I've been reading as much documentation as I can find, and [MDN's take](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Access-Control-Allow-Credentials) states that:

> For a CORS request with credentials, in order for browsers to expose the response to frontend JavaScript code, both the server (using the Access-Control-Allow-Credentials header) and the client (by setting the credentials mode for the XHR, Fetch, or Ajax request) must indicate that they‚Äôre opting in to including credentials.

So, how do I "set the credentials mode" for my XHR PUT request from Angular, if `withCredentials: true` is deprecated?

### What's the affected URL?**

https://angular.io/api/http/RequestOptions (deprecated), pointing to https://angular.io/guide/http which is lovely and shiny but doesn't mention anything about how to set the credentials mode.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "withCredentials deprecated, new docs don't cover setting credentials mode" (#27828)

Issues.Title: Child canLoad executes before parent canActivate on child reload.
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages as the source of the bug? -->
The issue is caused by package @angular/router

### Description
When using lazy loading with a canLoad guard, if we reload the page on the child (lazy loaded) route, the child canLoad gets called before the parent route canActivate.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-zhyqwj, click on loadChild then reload page and watch console, output is in this order: 
**ChildGuard canLoad
AppGuard canActivate
AppResolver resolve**

even though the order of the routes are like this:

`const routes: Routes = [
  {
    path: '',
    component: AppComponent,
    resolve: [AppResolver],
    children: [
      {
        path: '', canActivate: [AppGuard], children: [
          {
            path: 'child',
            loadChildren: 'app/child/child.module#ChildModule',
            canLoad: [ChildGuard]
          }
        ]
      }
    ]
  }
];`

## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**
7.0.1
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Child canLoad executes before parent canActivate on child reload." (#27826)

Issues.Title: ngc compiler points to relative path
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
Issue is caused by the NGC compiler


### Description
When running the ng compiler the output files have paths pointing towards relative paths in the parents node_modules folder.

We are expecting that this should point towards @angular/router in this specific case.

Clone https://github.com/mitsoe/compile-issue
npm install
npm run build
you can see the ngc output in the dist folder. this contains the relative paths to the node_modules of its parent.

Issues.Title: Angular Service worker not sending 'body' in POST request sometimes
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report
Angular Service worker is not sending 'body' in POST request sometimes. It works almost all the time, but, once in a while, I see that the POST request is sent with no body. When this happens, it continues to not send the body even after refreshing and disabling the cache. To resolve the issue, I open Application tab in dev tools, and stop and start the service worker, and it starts working, it starts sending 'body' for POST request.

I am unable to reproduce the issue whenever I want.

Also, @vicb in https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/23053 wrote: > We don't monitor close PRs nor issues so, I have to open new ticket for this. Issues.Title: BindingParser can't find user-created pipe in html file (Aot Compiler + Ivy)
Issues.Body: # üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/compiler ### Is this a regression? It was problem with new Ivy compiler. ### Description When compile with enableIvy: true and AoT mode, it prints `The pipe {name} cannot be found` error message. According to Ivy status website, It seems Pipe should be work in all the case. It only occurs in Ivy + Aot compile mode. I have 6 projects in production-level and i got same problem in all projects. Ivy + JIT works well. A clear and concise description of the problem... ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Sorry for not providing reproduction link. I don't have enough time now. I can try to create reproduction projects in next week. I create safe pipe in sharedModule ``` @Pipe({ name: 'safe' }) export class SafePipe { constructor(protected _sanitizer: DomSanitizer) { } transform(value: string, type: string): SafeHtml | SafeStyle | SafeScript | SafeUrl | SafeResourceUrl { switch (type) { case 'html': return this._sanitizer.bypassSecurityTrustHtml(value); case 'style': return this._sanitizer.bypassSecurityTrustStyle(value); case 'script': return this._sanitizer.bypassSecurityTrustScript(value); case 'url': return this._sanitizer.bypassSecurityTrustUrl(value); case 'resourceUrl': return this._sanitizer.bypassSecurityTrustResourceUrl(value); default: throw new Error(`Unable to bypass security for invalid type: ${type}`); } } } ``` and use it in html ``` ``` ## üî• Exception or Error **Exact message (CLI print):** ``` ERROR in : Template parse errors: The pipe 'safe' could not be found (" ][innerHtml]="content | safe:'html'">
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "BindingParser can't find user-created pipe in html file (Aot Compiler + Ivy)" (#27808)

Issues.Title: DEV mode change detection - Show warning if object reference changes in subsequent check
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request ### Relevant Package This feature request is for `@angular/core` ### Description When Angular does change detection, it will re-render the view whenever a property binding changes. There is a slight issue with _what_ Angular considers a "change". If an object reference changes to an object identical to the first one, Angular will update the view with this new object, even if the view ends up being identical to the previous one. This situation is easy for new developers to fall into, as it very easy to write a function like: ``` divClasses() { return { red: this.isRed }; } ``` and then bind it to an `[ngClass]` directive, which will remove and re-apply the `red` class every change detection call, because `divClasses()` returns a new object every time it is run. ```
``` This causes two big problems, the first being inefficient view rendering. Change detection only needs to update the view whenever the component's `isRed` value changes, but it ends up updating the view every single time change detection is run. This would slow down the page and negatively impact the end user's experience. The less obvious problem is the possibility of change detection recursion. If the application has a `MutationObserver` somewhere, watching for DOM changes, the above function will cause it to run every time change detection is ran. If this `MutationObserver` also triggers a change detection check, the page will hang as the `divClasses()` function updates the view, triggering the `MutationObserver`, which triggers change detection again. This might not even directly be the developer's fault, as the `MutationObserver` could be from a 3rd party library. I recently spent a day and a half attempting to debug an application hanging in this way. Funnily enough, the problem was made worse by a 3rd party library which modified `console.log` to run change detection - which caused recursion to happen again. Ultimately, I suspect this scenario might be the cause of issues like https://github.com/valor-software/ngx-bootstrap/issues/3047, https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/20450, or https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/24614. ### Describe the solution you'd like To be clear, my proposed "fix" does *NOT* involve modifying Angular's change detection to deeply compare object references. Discussion on this bug: https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/24614 was ultimately tabled because the proposed fix involved deep equality checks, which would be inefficient and very time consuming to check larger objects. Ultimately, the issue here seems to be with functions like my example `divClasses()`, which inadvertently abuse change detection to unnecessarily update the view. If there was some way to alert the developer that a function they've written was possibly faulty, that would probably be the way to go. Currently, Angular displays warnings for change detection when the application is running in dev mode for a similar scenario. If change detection itself causes a property/function to change its output, Angular currently displays a warning about what happened. Could it be possible to display a similar warning for whenever a function returns a different object reference on subsequent change detection calls? A reference check would not be very expensive, and this may end up helping the application developer optimize their program.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "DEV mode change detection - Show warning if object reference changes in subsequent check" (#27804)

Issues.Title: Bug(ngtools/webpack): elideImports transformer mistakenly treat jsxFactory as unused import
Issues.Body:
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`) ``` - [x] bug report -> please search issues before submitting - [ ] feature request ``` ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Versions ``` node --version v11.2.0 npm --version 6.5.0 ng --version _ _ ____ _ ___ / \ _ __ __ _ _ _| | __ _ _ __ / ___| | |_ _| / ‚ñ≥ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__| | | | | | | / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | | | |___| |___ | | /_/ \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_| \____|_____|___| |___/ Angular CLI: 7.1.4 Node: 11.2.0 OS: darwin x64 Angular: 7.1.4 ... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic ... router Package Version ----------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.11.4 @angular-devkit/build-angular 0.11.4 @angular-devkit/build-optimizer 0.11.4 @angular-devkit/build-webpack 0.11.4 @angular-devkit/core 7.1.4 @angular-devkit/schematics 7.1.4 @ngtools/webpack 7.1.4 @schematics/angular 7.1.4 @schematics/update 0.11.4 rxjs 6.3.3 typescript 3.1.6 webpack 4.23.1 ``` ### Repro steps Say that current `jsxFactory` being set to `createElement`, given an Angular `.tsx` file, like: ```typescript import { Component } from '@angular/core'; import { createElement } from './render'; console.log(

123

); @Component({ selector: 'app-root', templateUrl: './app.component.html', styleUrls: ['./app.component.css'] }) export class AppComponent { title = 'ng-tmp-c'; } ``` When building with AOT, the `AngularCompilerPlugin` would apply [`removeDecorators`](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/0b7dd0e9c0a76b1f46feafa01104e5f0d3b4d8b6/packages/ngtools/webpack/src/angular_compiler_plugin.ts#L849) transformer to the build process. As this Angular file contains some decorator (`@Component()` here), `removeDecorators` is activated and uses [`elideImports`](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/0b7dd0e9c0a76b1f46feafa01104e5f0d3b4d8b6/packages/ngtools/webpack/src/transformers/make_transform.ts#L47) transformer to remove unused decorator imports. Inside that `elideImports` transformer, it [records "all" the used imports](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/0b7dd0e9c0a76b1f46feafa01104e5f0d3b4d8b6/packages/ngtools/webpack/src/transformers/elide_imports.ts#L62-L64), but it doesn't deal with jsx node properly as not transformed yet, so that `jsxFactory` is not an identifier and not being recorded. Then the import being removed and results to a broken file: ```javascript // createElement becomes global variable here console.log(createElement("p", null, "123")); var AppComponent = /** @class */ (function () { function AppComponent() { this.title = 'ng-tmp-c'; } return AppComponent; }()); ``` ### The log given by the failure N/A ### Desired functionality Support `.tsx` in AOT like what in JIT. ### Mention any other details that might be useful Suggested labels: `type: bug/fix`, `effort1: easy`, `freq1: low`, `severity3: broken`, `workaround2: non-obvious`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Bug(ngtools/webpack): elideImports transformer mistakenly treat jsxFactory as unused import" (#13297)

import { ModuleBRoutingModule } from './module-b-routing.module';
import { ComponentGlistComponent } from './component-glist/component-glist.component';

@NgModule({
    declarations: [ComponentGlistComponent],
    imports: [
        CommonModule,
        FormsModule,
        ModuleBRoutingModule,
        AmazingTimePickerModule,
        AngularFontAwesomeModule,
        NgbModule
    ]
})
export class ModuleBModule { }

```
 

### The log given by the failure
Look at size progess for prod builds: 

origin sizie
```
  -rw-rw-r-- 1 dan dan   1108 gru 22 20:40 5.2d738201223bf834d251.js
  -rw-rw-r-- 1 dan dan 281315 gru 22 20:40 main.1e7a42998bc677470d9c.js
```
with awesome time picker
```
  -rw-rw-r-- 1 dan dan 227767 gru 22 20:37 5.b1f022d4fa5721f64060.js
  -rw-rw-r-- 1 dan dan 295078 gru 22 20:37 main.0ad51b8fbb6b59a7fa9a.js
```
with ng bootstrap + awesome time picker 
```
  -rw-rw-r-- 1 dan dan 593644 gru 22 22:03 5.af20dde0d5192ca0872b.js
  -rw-rw-r-- 1 dan dan 309346 gru 22 22:03 main.aac5430a183d20963769.js
```

mean while main.js size is const for non prod build
```
  -rw-rw-r-- 1 dan dan   10031 gru 22 20:43 main.js
  -rw-rw-r-- 1 dan dan 3518353 gru 22 20:42 vendor.js
```


I tried to diff minified fiels the different is not significant:
```
...
-r.c(e,t),e.prototype._next=function(t){var
+r.__extends(e,t),e.prototype._next=function(t){var
...
```

 I non minified size stays the same so I guess it is doable for minified.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "main.js size affected by import in lazy module" (#13287)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): allow .svg files as templates
Issues.Body:
Components can now use .svg files as templates. To distinguish .svg files
in templates from .svg files used for other purposes, a new webpack
loader rule is added that tests for .component.svg and loads these
files with raw-loader. All other .svg files are loaded as before
with file-loader. For use cases and alternative solutions, see
the discussion in #10567

Closes #10567
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): allow .svg files as templates" (#13284)

Issues.Title: project type library doesn't allow deleteOutputPath option
Issues.Body:
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [x] bug report 
- [ ] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Versions

Node.js v10.14.2
npm v6.4.1
Angular CLI v7.0.7
OS: Windows 7


### Repro steps

Adding the `deleteOutputPath` option to the `angular.json` produces an error when the project's `projectType` is `library`. The documentation states that the options apply to either "an app or a library," but this doesn't appear to be the case.


### The log given by the failure
```
Schema validation failed with the following errors:
  Data path "" should NOT have additional properties(deleteOutputPath).
```

### Desired functionality

Desired functionality is that the option be available similarly for both apps and libraries or that the documentation be updated with what options are available per project type.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "project type library doesn't allow deleteOutputPath option" (#13274)

Issues.Title: Scrolling SDK (virtual-scroll) - View isn't updated when list is updated (items added/removed)
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior? If a data-list that binded to ``, is updated (items are added/ removed from this list), the `` updated as well. #### What is the current behavior? Changing the list will not updated the view (``) #### What are the steps to reproduce? StackBlitz starter: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-hsr4tz?file=app%2Fcdk-virtual-scroll-overview-example.html
In this demo you can see that after adding items to the list, the view isn't updated. #### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? Angular 7.1.4 Material 7.2.0 Browser: Chrome #### Is there anything else we should know? The documentation doesn't discuss about adding/removing items from data-list. See docs at: https://material.angular.io/cdk/scrolling/overview

Issues.Title: feat(tabs): add automatic scrolling when holding down paginator
Issues.Body:
Adds some code that automatically keeps scrolling the tab header while holding down one of the paginator buttons. This is useful on long lists of tabs where the user might have to click a lot to reach the tab that they want.

Fixes #6510.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(tabs): add automatic scrolling when holding down paginator" (#14632)

Issues.Title: Datepicker out of viewport
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Datepicker should be inside of the viewport and be fully rendered

#### What is the current behavior?
Sometimes it's out of viewport so that user is unable to do anything. Also it's impossible to scroll to that part that is "invisible". Moreover, sometimes datepicker is in viewport, however it's back rendered till last line and 31 Dec is out of datepicker.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
It could be reproduced in any project that uses datepicker. The idea is to make datepicker field from the end of viewport/page on about 4/5 of datepicker calendar size. Thus, we get this 1/5 out of available space.

To reproduce the second screenshot you will need to make your window height as narrow as about 300px


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
"@angular/core": "^6.1.10"
"@angular/material": "^7.2.0"
"typescript": "~2.9.2"
MacOS, Ubuntu
Chrome

#### Is there anything else we should know?
![screen shot 2018-12-25 at 10 43 05](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22374911/50418046-1a0da680-0832-11e9-8865-5aa9b303c32b.png)
It's bottom of the page in Chrome on macOS.
The same behaviour was observed in Chrome on Ubuntu.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22374911/50418310-61486700-0833-11e9-85bd-a41c507c2a05.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Datepicker out of viewport" (#14631)

Issues.Title: cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport behaves different in mac's and windows' chrome v70
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior? Scrolling experience should be the same across different OS on Chrome. #### What is the current behavior? On Mac, behavior is normal. When I use mouse wheel to scroll down with the cursor in the viewport, after the item list in the viewport reaches bottom, if I continue scroll down on my mouse, the webpage will start to move up. But on Windows' chrome v70, after the items list has reached the bottom, I need to scroll down multiple times on my mousewheel to let the webpage start to move up. It feels like you need to scroll 3 times more to reach the bottom. The same happens when I scroll up. I tested on an old windows laptop which runs chrome 63 and that one does not have such behavior. I'm not sure this is a Chrome issue or library issue. #### What are the steps to reproduce? Providing a StackBlitz reproduction is the *best* way to share your issue.
https://angular-material2-issue-qi74ey.stackblitz.io
#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? cdk 7.2, windows 10, Chrome 71.0.3578.98 #### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport behaves different in mac's and windows' chrome v70 " (#14628)

Issues.Title: fix(button-toggle): remove references to selected toggle on destroy
Issues.Body: Currently when a button toggle is destroyed, we still keep a reference to it in the selection model which is leaky and causes the model value to be inaccurate. These changes remove the reference.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(button-toggle): remove references to selected toggle on destroy" (#14627)

Issues.Title: Expansion Panel - Remove from DOM when closed/minimized
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
I would like the "expansion-panel" be removed from the DOM when minimized/closed and not hidden with CSS style.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?
I have a "mat-accordion" with a list of "mat-expansion-panel" - a very long list, between 500 to 1000 items.
Each "mat-expansion-panel" has a child element: "mat-expansion-panel-content". This element is hidden with CSS style (visibility: hidden;) when the mat-expansion-panel is minimized/closed. 
Due to this there is a big performance issue, since the browser need to handle all of these hidden DOM objects.

I would like "mat-expansion-panel-content" will be removed from the DOM when the "mat-expansion-panel" is closed - with *ngIf or any other way and not only hidden. 

#### Is there anything else we should know?

I would like to now if there is any work around this issue, if a framework solution (development) will not be presented soon.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Expansion Panel - Remove from DOM when closed/minimized" (#14626)

Issues.Title: fix(paginator): update page index if invalid after length change
Issues.Body:
Updates the page index of a paginator if its length changed to something where the index isn't valid anymore (e.g. the user is on the last page and the amount of pages becomes smaller).

Fixes #14520.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(paginator): update page index if invalid after length change" (#14625)

Issues.Title: fix(tabs): align active tab styles with spec
Issues.Body:
Fixes the styling for active tabs not being aligned with the spec. According to the spec, they're supposed to have the current color, however in our case they retain the default text color. These changes also align the ripple colors.

Fixes #2058.

For reference, here's what the spec looks like:
![mio-design_assets_1xbnadj-1y46fsn4un5ak5-f2vtolldil_tabs-spec-scrollable](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4450522/50399878-4b7f6700-078b-11e9-813c-37dc7a10b8d8.png)

These are our tabs:
![tabs__angular_material_-_google_chrome_2018-12-24_14-47-33](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4450522/50399885-56d29280-078b-11e9-9566-adce1e219a7b.png)

And this is after the changes:
![angular_material_-_google_chrome_2018-12-24_14-47-49](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4450522/50399888-5e923700-078b-11e9-99d0-57db5e20d45c.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(tabs): align active tab styles with spec" (#14623)

Issues.Title: fix(tooltip): afterHidden stream not being completed
Issues.Body: Fixes the `afterHidden` stream not being completed, which causes the host tooltip directive to accumulate subscriptions for every time it is opened, until the entire view is destroyed.

Issues.Title: fix(typography): unable to override tag selectors inside .mat-typography
Issues.Body:
Currently we've got two sets of typography selectors: some that target tags under `.mat-typography` (e.g. `.mat-typography h1`) and others that target a specific class (e.g. `.mat-title`). The intention with the class selectors was also to allow for the styles of a tag to be replaced (e.g. having an `h3` look like an `h2` if necessary), however that wasn't possible while inside `.mat-typography`, because the tag selectors were more specific. These changes update the class selectors to make it possible to override the tag selectors.

Fixes #14597.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(typography): unable to override tag selectors inside .mat-typography" (#14617)

Issues.Title: feat(overlay): allow for connected overlay to be positioned relative to a point
Issues.Body:
Allows for the connected overlay's origin to be set to a point on the page, rather than a DOM element. This allows people to easily implement right click context menus.

Relates to #5007.

For reference, here's a context menu implemented with `mat-menu` and minimal changes:
![demo2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4450522/50384826-30512080-06d3-11e9-8b95-175c0d438e61.gif)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(overlay): allow for connected overlay to be positioned relative to a point" (#14616)

Issues.Body:

Issues.Title: build: switch to docs-content from examples package
Issues.Body:
With https://github.com/angular/material.angular.io/pull/565 the docs-content will be pulled from the `@angular/material-examples` package. Changes needed on this repository:

* Since we update some styles and logic in favor of simplicity, we need to update the Dgeni templates to conform with these changes.
* Remove the unnecessary `examplesPath` property member because we now compute the `docs-content/` asset paths in a consistent way and don't want to mix up the source locations.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: switch to docs-content from examples package" (#14612)

Issues.Title: getRtlScrollAxisType detects incorrect RtlScrollAxisType for safari
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior? In safari, `getRtlScrollAxisType() === RtlScrollAxisType.NEGATED` #### What is the current behavior? `getRtlScrollAxisType()` returns `RtlScrollAxisType.INVERTED` #### What are the steps to reproduce? Providing a StackBlitz reproduction is the *best* way to share your issue.
StackBlitz starter: https://goo.gl/wwnhMV
#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? - Angular/Angular Material 7.0.4 - macOS 10.13.6 - Safari version 12.0.2 (13606.3.4.1.4) #### Is there anything else we should know? Problem unlikely to do with safari and os. Other libraries detected it correctly using feature detection technique
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "getRtlScrollAxisType detects incorrect RtlScrollAxisType for safari" (#14609)
